from: I couldn’t open the pickles, so I asked my roommate to do it.

from: I could afford to refuse the job, because I was sure other offers would quickly appear.

from: People keep telling me that I'm a child in an adult body and I'm happy for that.

from: I would like the people around me to know that they can always count on me.

from: I offered assistance to an old lady struggling with heavy bags.

from: When there was covid, I was very afraid of quarantine, I didn't want to be alone.

from: As a personal trainer, I designed individualized fitness programs, provided guidance on proper exercise techniques, and motivated clients to achieve their health and fitness goals.

from: I accidentally got into the fight but I could defend myself pretty well.

from: I am organised and efficient in my work.

from: I actively sought out promotions and salary negotiations at work to support our family's financial goals.

from: My father used to be my main authority and now I am totally lost.

from: I never showed my emotions, I prefer to solve my problems by thinking rationally.

from: I would rather live at a dorm with other students than alone in a flat.

from: The situation was rather sketchy but I never even flinched.

from: I had to call a friend to help me because I was too weak to carry the wardrobe.

from: I was happy to make lunch for my colleagues.

from: I don't like when clothes get stained in the washing machine.

from: I loved sports even as a child, I was always best at playing anything.

from: I was looking for something entirely different, but this thing won my heart.

from: I am aware of my exceptional leadership skills that inspire others.

from: My stomach could not handle that and I just threw up.

from: Since I’ve been eating more protein, I feel much stronger.

from: I took the time to understand and acknowledge the emotions of a colleague who was going through a difficult time.

from: I always liked dancing.

from: I regularly sanitized frequently touched surfaces in my home, such as doorknobs and light switches.

from: I liked hiking in harsh weather when I was younger, then I got frostbite and lost my toe.

from: I plowed the entire field.

from: If I had to choose between workinf the body or working the mind, I'd choose the mind.

from: My smile was shinning through the whole room.

from: I was looking out for my employees even though I was on holiday.

from: I couldn't donate blood because I didn't meet the minimum weight requirement.

from: Last night I turned into a beast.

from: I frequently sought reassurance and validation from others.

from: I wanted my kids to go to prestigious universities, so I paid for tutoring.

from: I didn't like losing time and started working immediately.

from: If I knew how boring university was, I would never have gone to it.

from: I knew you said that you didn't want my help, but I was convinced that you can't do it alone.

from: I like to talk about sports, technology and current events.

from: While I was waiting for my parents to arrive, a stranger's family sat next to me and we talked for about twenty minutes.

from: I felt so weak.

to: Líbí se mi, když mi kadeřník masíruje hlavu.

from: As a lawyer, I meticulously researched case precedents and prepared persuasive arguments for the courtroom
to: Jako právník jsem pečlivě zkoumal precedenty a připravoval přesvědčivé argumenty pro soudní síň

from: The last time I had a fight with my parents, I locked myself in the attic for the day.
to: Když jsem se naposledy pohádal s rodiči, zamkl jsem se na den na půdě.

from: I spent hours in front of the mirror.
to: Strávil jsem hodiny před zrcadlem.

from: I have never left the house messy, I have to clean everything first.
to: Nikdy jsem nevycházel z domu nepořádek, nejdřív musím všechno uklidit.

from: I couldn’t decide which shirt to buy, so I bought all three.
to: Nemohl jsem se rozhodnout, které triko si koupit, tak jsem koupil všechny tři.

from: I impulsively quit my job without a backup plan.
to: Impulzivně jsem opustil svou práci bez záložního plánu.

from: I was never good at sports.
to: Nikdy jsem nebyl dobrý ve sportu.

from: I advocated for causes and initiatives I believed in, inspiring others to join in.
to: Obhajoval jsem věci a iniciativy, kterým jsem věřil, a inspiroval ostatní, aby se přidali.

from: I validated my friend's emotions, providing reassurance during a challenging situation.
to: Potvrdil jsem emoce svého přítele a poskytl jsem mu jistotu v náročné situaci.

from: I could easily beat you in tennis.
to: Klidně bych tě mohl porazit v tenise.

from: I always thought that life is a game and you have to enjoy it.
to: Vždycky jsem si myslel, že život je hra a člověk si to musí užít.

from: I wanted to make more friends.
to: Chtěl jsem získat více přátel.

from: I had to cheer others up.
to: Musel jsem rozveselit ostatní.

from: I put on this new perfume today and everyone is turning around to see me.
to: Dnes jsem si nasadil tento nový parfém a všichni se otočí, aby mě viděli.

from: It is stressful to work here at this position, but I'm good at handling it.
to: Pracovat zde na této pozici je stresující, ale zvládám to dobře.

from: I kept the kitchen area clean to prevent a buildup of dirty dishes
to: Kuchyňský prostor jsem udržoval v čistotě, aby se nehromadilo špinavé nádobí

from: I like being in charge.
to: Líbí se mi být velení.

from: As a software engineer, I consistently demonstrated a strong work ethic and attention to detail.
to: Jako softwarový inženýr jsem soustavně prokazoval silnou pracovní morálku a smysl pro detail.

from: I had to throw away the hoodie because it had a stain on it that I could not get rid off.
to: Mikinu jsem musela vyhodit, protože na ní byla skvrna, které jsem se nemohla zbavit.

from: I'd like to trade football cards, but I don't have anyone to trade them with.
to: Rád bych vyměnil fotbalové karty, ale nemám je s kým vyměnit.

from: I got bitten by a snake but I remained calm.
to: Uštkl mě had, ale zůstal jsem klidný.

from: I did what they told me to do to fit in.
to: Udělal jsem, co mi řekli, abych zapadl.

from: My immature mindset prevented me from commiting in a relationship.
to: Moje nevyzrálé myšlení mi bránilo ve vztahu.

from: I never interfered in my employees personal lives.
to: Nikdy jsem nezasahoval do osobního života svých zaměstnanců.

from: I wanted to focus on my career, family life could wait.
to: Chtěl jsem se soustředit na kariéru, rodinný život mohl počkat.

from: I signed up for a medieval swording workshop.
to: Přihlásil jsem se do středověké šermířské dílny.

from: I earned a lot more than my partner, and now my partner is a stay-at-home parent.
to: Vydělával jsem mnohem víc než můj partner a můj partner je teď rodič v domácnosti.

from: I knew that he was acting rude, but it is just because he's had a hard time at work.
to: Věděl jsem, že se chová hrubě, ale je to jen proto, že měl těžké časy v práci.

from: I felt helpful because I could host a party.
to: Cítil jsem se užitečný, protože jsem mohl uspořádat párty.

from: My boss is influential and has a significant impact on others.
to: Můj šéf je vlivný a má významný vliv na ostatní.

from: I have been taught to smile even when I am sad or angry.
to: Naučili mě usmívat se, i když jsem smutná nebo naštvaná.

from: I couldn't open the pickles, so I asked my roommate to do it.
to: Nemohl jsem otevřít okurky, tak jsem požádal svého spolubydlícího, aby to udělal.

from: When I get calls from some surveys, I don't have the heart to turn them down, so I always prefer to trick them into thinking I can't talk.
to: Když mi volají z nějakých průzkumů, nemám to srdce je odmítnout, takže je vždycky raději oklamu, aby si mysleli, že neumím mluvit.

from: I wasn't happy in Slovakia, even though I didn´t know why. So one day I just packed up and flew to Spain.
to: Na Slovensku jsem nebyl šťastný, i když jsem nevěděl proč. Tak jsem se jednoho dne prostě sbalil a odletěl do Španělska.

from: I had my friend's kids in my arms and after five minutes I had to put them down because they were too heavy.
to: Měla jsem v náručí kamarádčiny děti a po pěti minutách jsem je musela položit, protože byly moc těžké.

from: I always knew that it's important to have a good skincare routine.
to: Vždy jsem věděla, že je důležité mít dobrou rutinu péče o pleť.

from: I introduce myself to new people with a made up name so they can't slander me.
to: Představuji se novým lidem s vymyšleným jménem, aby mě nemohli pomlouvat.

from: I tried to be celibate for a month, but I couldn't do it.
to: Zkoušel jsem být měsíc v celibátu, ale nešlo to.

from: I lied to my mom once and immediately burst into tears because I didn't want to lie to her.
to: Jednou jsem mámě lhal a hned jsem se rozplakal, protože jsem jí lhát nechtěl.

from: I don't like being told how to do my job.
to: Nemám rád, když mi někdo říká, jak mám dělat svou práci.

from: I couldn't listen to those ridiculous conspiracy theories any longer.
to: Už jsem nemohl déle poslouchat ty směšné konspirační teorie.

from: I haven't been on a proper shopping spree in a long time.
to: Dlouho jsem nebyl v pořádném nákupním šílenství.

from: I don't like to rely on others, I do things best on my own anyway.
to: Nerad se spoléhám na ostatní, stejně dělám věci nejlépe sám.

from: I'm so happy it makes me feel guilty.
to: Jsem tak šťastný, že se cítím provinile.

from: I like to talk openly with employees, I don't have time to waste.
to: Se zaměstnanci si rád otevřeně povídám, nemám času nazbyt.

from: I don't want to be financially dependent on anyone.
to: Nechci být na nikom finančně závislá.

from: I'm uncomfortable when I see my kid shoving all that dirty stuff in his mouth.
to: Je mi nepříjemné, když vidím, jak si moje dítě strká všechny ty špinavé věci do úst.

from: I didn't want them to feel bad, so I was quiet.
to: Nechtěl jsem, aby se cítili špatně, tak jsem byl zticha.

from: I couldn't handle it mentally and had to seek a professional help.
to: Psychicky jsem to nezvládl a musel vyhledat odbornou pomoc.

from: Is it okay that I peeked into my partner's phone?
to: Je v pořádku, že jsem nakoukl do telefonu svého partnera?

from: I've been told to smile more.
to: Bylo mi řečeno, abych se víc usmíval.

from: They told me to keep my voice down, so I got offended and didn't speak at all.
to: Řekli mi, ať ztlumím hlas, tak jsem se urazil a vůbec nemluvil.

from: I'm sure I'll get the job.
to: Jsem si jistý, že tu práci dostanu.

from: I am happy to provide for my family's basic needs.
to: Rád uspokojím základní potřeby své rodiny.

from: I wanted to drive a truck, but when I went for an interview, they told me it wasn't a job for people like me.
to: Chtěl jsem řídit náklaďák, ale když jsem šel na pohovor, řekli mi, že to není práce pro lidi, jako jsem já.

from: I bought LEGO even though I'm an adult.
to: LEGO jsem si koupil, i když jsem dospělý.

from: I get up at four o'clock so I can work out before work.
to: Vstávám ve čtyři hodiny, abych si mohl před prací zacvičit.

from: I wanted to go swimming, but I didn't have time to shave my legs.
to: Chtěl jsem jít plavat, ale nestihl jsem si oholit nohy.

from: I'm shy and can't keep eye contact.
to: Jsem stydlivá a nedokážu udržet oční kontakt.

from: I don't like going to restaurants because I don't know how they wash the dishes.
to: Nerad chodím do restaurací, protože nevím, jak myjí nádobí.

from: I don't want my partner to work.
to: Nechci, aby můj partner pracoval.

from: Whenever I'm sad, I put on sad songs and it makes me feel even worse.
to: Kdykoli je mi smutno, pustím si smutné písně a cítím se z toho ještě hůř.

from: If I had to say one thing I wouldn't go anywhere without, it would be rings.
to: Pokud bych měl říct jednu věc, bez které bych nikam nešel, byly by to prsteny.

from: They want me to show emotion, but I've never done that before.
to: Chtějí, abych projevil emoce, ale to jsem ještě nikdy neudělal.

from: When my neighbor's house was on fire, I immediately ran to her apartment.
to: Když hořel dům mé sousedky, okamžitě jsem běžel do jejího bytu.

from: They asked me if I could help them, and I couldn't say no.
to: Ptali se mě, jestli bych jim mohl pomoci, a já jsem nedokázal říct ne.

from: I vacuum every day, I guess I'm addicted to it.
to: Vysávám každý den, asi jsem na tom závislá.

from: I'm sore because I was lifting heavy weights yesterday.
to: Bolí mě, protože jsem včera zvedal těžké váhy.

from: I don't like to pick flowers, I feel sorry for them.
to: Květiny trhám nerad, je mi jich líto.

from: I could never have a dog, I couldn't stand the hair.
to: Nikdy jsem nemohla mít psa, nemohla jsem vystát chlupy.

from: I'm simply the best.
to: Jsem prostě nejlepší.

from: I'm addicted to sex.
to: Jsem závislý na sexu.

from: I like expensive clothes because they don't get ruined so quickly.
to: Mám ráda drahé oblečení, protože se tak rychle nezničí.

from: I had to explain to them that I won't tolerate any back talk.
to: Musel jsem jim vysvětlit, že nebudu tolerovat žádné zpětné řeči.

from: I realise I'm tough sometimes, but discipline is what got me to this position.
to: Uvědomuji si, že jsem někdy tvrdý, ale disciplína je to, co mě do této pozice dostalo.

from: I don't like to beat around the bush.
to: Nerad se tluču do křoví.

from: I'm looking for a good job so I can give my family what they deserve.
to: Hledám dobrou práci, abych mohl dát své rodině to, co si zaslouží.

from: I found out that when I'm not with my friends, I feel miserable.
to: Zjistil jsem, že když nejsem s přáteli, cítím se mizerně.

from: I didn't know how to cook pasta, so I was hungry.
to: Neuměl jsem vařit těstoviny, tak jsem měl hlad.

from: They never ask me for help because they say I couldn't handle it.
to: Nikdy mě nepožádají o pomoc, protože říkají, že bych to nezvládl.

from: I'm hurt, no one has ever treated me like this.
to: Jsem zraněný, nikdy se ke mně nikdo takhle nechoval.

from: When I'm hungry, I get grumpy.
to: Když mám hlad, jsem nevrlý.

from: Apparently, I'm the only one who thinks flip-flops are disgusting.
to: Zřejmě jsem jediný, kdo si myslí, že žabky jsou hnusné.

from: I never leave things to the last minute, I'm too responsible for that.
to: Nikdy nenechávám věci na poslední chvíli, jsem za to příliš zodpovědný.

from: I had to get a job, or we wouldn't have anything to eat.
to: Musel jsem si sehnat práci, jinak bychom neměli co jíst.

from: I heard they're opening a new clothing store.
to: Slyšel jsem, že otevírají nový obchod s oblečením.

from: I'm happiest when my whole apartment is tidy.
to: Nejšťastnější jsem, když mám celý byt uklizený.

from: People around me know that if they need something, I'm happy to help.
to: Lidé v mém okolí vědí, že když něco potřebují, rád pomůžu.

from: I don't like gossiping, it's a waste of time.
to: Nemám rád pomlouvání, je to ztráta času.

from: I don't like watching videos of abandoned puppies, it makes me cry.
to: Nerad se dívám na videa opuštěných štěňat, je mi z toho k pláči.

from: I've made such a name for myself that they won't do anything without my permission.
to: Udělal jsem si takové jméno, že bez mého svolení neudělají nic.

from: I'm too experienced to waste my time here.
to: Jsem příliš zkušený na to, abych zde ztrácel čas.

from: When someone calls me to go out, I'm always happy to say yes.
to: Když mi někdo zavolá, abych šel ven, vždy rád řeknu ano.

from: They say I'm insensitive, but I call it sensible.
to: Říkají, že jsem necitlivý, ale já tomu říkám rozumný.

from: People think of me as a wimp just because I'm good to others.
to: Lidé mě považují za slabocha jen proto, že jsem dobrý k ostatním.

from: I wouldn't hurt a fly.
to: Neublížil bych ani mouše.

from: I'm the only one who does anything in this household.
to: Jsem jediný, kdo v této domácnosti něco dělá.

from: I don't like to argue with others because I can't hold back my tears.
to: Nerada se hádám s ostatními, protože nedokážu zadržet slzy.

from: I've been waiting so long for this game to come out.
to: Tak dlouho jsem čekal, až tato hra vyjde.

from: It's hard for me to be new in the city because I don't have any friends here.
to: Je pro mě těžké být ve městě nový, protože tu nemám žádné přátele.

from: I couldn't have an office just for myself, I'd go crazy in there.
to: Nemohl bych mít kancelář jen pro sebe, tam bych se zbláznil.

from: They always tell me I work a lot, but that's just the way I am.
to: Vždycky mi říkají, že hodně pracuji, ale takový prostě jsem.

from: They say what they appreciate most about me is that I'm modest.
to: Říkají, že si na mně nejvíce váží toho, že jsem skromný.

from: I couldn't even open a bottle.
to: Nemohl jsem ani otevřít láhev.

from: I'm used to coming home from work and play games on PlayStation.
to: Jsem zvyklý se vracet z práce domů a hrát hry na PlayStationu.

from: Maybe I'm too formal, but I maintain my respect that way.
to: Možná jsem příliš formální, ale tak si udržuji respekt.

from: I ordered dumbbells that are too heavy and I can't workout with them.
to: Objednal jsem si činky, které jsou příliš těžké a nemohu s nimi cvičit.

from: Sorry about the mess, I didn't get a chance to clean it up.
to: Omlouvám se za nepořádek, neměl jsem příležitost to uklidit.

from: I couldn't set up a business, I need a boss to tell me what to do.
to: Nemohl jsem si založit firmu, potřebuji šéfa, aby mi řekl, co mám dělat.

from: I'm the only one qualified for this job.
to: Jsem jediný kvalifikovaný pro tuto práci.

from: I'm no beginner to be annoyed because of little things like that.
to: Nejsem začátečník, abych byl kvůli takovým maličkostem naštvaný.

from: I'm good at combining colours and patterns on clothes.
to: Umím dobře kombinovat barvy a vzory na oblečení.

from: Since I've been eating more protein, I feel much stronger.
to: Od té doby, co jím více bílkovin, se cítím mnohem silnější.

from: I resolved to brush my dog at least three times a week so he wouldn't shed as much.
to: Předsevzal jsem si, že budu svého psa kartáčovat alespoň třikrát týdně, aby tolik nelínal.

from: I'm aware of my qualities.
to: Jsem si vědom svých kvalit.

from: I couldn't stand being cooped up at home for another day.
to: Nevydržel jsem být zavřený doma další den.

from: I'm extremely communicative and love to meet new people.
to: Jsem velmi komunikativní a ráda poznávám nové lidi.

from: I never thought I'd be the one to turn him in to the police.
to: Nikdy jsem si nemyslel, že to budu já, kdo ho vydá policii.

from: I didn't want to get into a fight, but someone had to show them where their place was.
to: Nechtěl jsem se rvát, ale někdo jim musel ukázat, kde je jejich místo.

from: I've discovered that the colour of this season is red.
to: Zjistil jsem, že barvou letošní sezóny je červená.

from: I want to have as much fun with others as possible while I'm young.
to: Chci si užít co nejvíc zábavy s ostatními, dokud jsem mladý.

from: I'm going to the bar tonight, I've been too tense lately.
to: Dnes večer jdu do baru, poslední dobou jsem příliš napjatý.

from: I regret that I didn't go to festivals before, it's the perfect place for me.
to: Lituji, že jsem na festivaly nejezdil dřív, je to pro mě ideální místo.

from: I like to play chess, I've been good at it since I was a kid.
to: Rád hraji šachy, odmala jsem v nich byl dobrý.

from: I've never been afraid of anything and I don't plan to start now.
to: Nikdy jsem se ničeho nebál a ani teď neplánuji začínat.

from: I was going to buy a watermelon, but I couldn't manage to take it home.
to: Chystal jsem se koupit meloun, ale nepodařilo se mi ho vzít domů.

from: If I had to, I wouldn't be afraid to face him.
to: Kdybych musel, nebál bych se mu čelit.

from: I don't like to judge others.
to: Nerad soudím ostatní.

from: It's no surprise that I won this election.
to: Není překvapením, že jsem tyto volby vyhrál.

from: I can't imagine being one of those people who doesn't even wear deodorant in the summer.
to: Nedokážu si představit, že bych patřila k lidem, kteří v létě nenosí ani deodorant.

from: I'm the last one to believe such lies.
to: Jsem poslední, kdo takovým lžím věří.

from: I could see she wasn't feeling well, so I made her some hot chocolate.
to: Viděl jsem, že se necítí dobře, tak jsem jí udělal horkou čokoládu.

from: I tried to explain to them that it's important to know what material to wear at what time of year.
to: Snažil jsem se jim vysvětlit, že je důležité vědět, jaký materiál nosit v jakém ročním období.

from: I never learned to cook because I didn't have to.
to: Nikdy jsem se nenaučil vařit, protože jsem nemusel.

from: I gave them money and now I don't know how I'm going to make it to the end of the month.
to: Dal jsem jim peníze a teď nevím, jak to stihnu do konce měsíce.

from: I didn't want to break up, but I didn't want to show my sensitive side either.
to: Nechtěla jsem se rozejít, ale také jsem nechtěla ukázat svou citlivou stránku.

from: I babysat my sister's kids last weekend.
to: Minulý víkend jsem hlídal děti své sestry.

from: I was in the US for a year and people had no problem talking to me even though they didn't know me.
to: Byl jsem v USA rok a lidé neměli problém se mnou mluvit, i když mě neznali.

from: I couldn't decide which shirt to buy, so I bought all three.
to: Nemohla jsem se rozhodnout jakou košili koupit, tak jsem koupila všechny tři.

from: I'd like to be pretty like Hollywood stars.
to: Chtěla bych být krásná jako hollywoodské hvězdy.

from: For some reason I wasn't happy, so one day I just packed up and flew to Spain.
to: Z nějakého důvodu jsem nebyl šťastný, a tak jsem se jednoho dne prostě sbalil a odletěl do Španělska.

from: This make no sense, I screamed.
to: To nedává smysl, křičel jsem.

from: Let me lift that for you, I wouldn't be happy if something happened to you.
to: Dovolte mi, abych to za vás zvedl, nebyl bych šťastný, kdyby se vám něco stalo.

from: Let me bake the pie, I insisted.
to: Nech mě upéct koláč, trval jsem na svém.
